Detailed Description

This is the base class of all learning objects.

Member Function Documentation

static plJointDistribution plLearner::learn_model_parameters ( const std::vector< plLearnObject * > &  learn_objects,
plDataDescriptor &  data_descriptor 
)
static

Learns the parameters of a model.

There can be arbitrary missing data in the learning observations provided by data_descriptor. An EM (Expectation-Maximization) algorithm is used. This EM algorithm is implemented using plEMLearner. The EM algorithm is initialized using the initial parameters from learn_objects and is run until convergence.

Parameters
[in]learn_objectsa vector of incremental learning objects allowing to provide the structure (dependencies), the parametrical form of each distribution, and the corresponding priors.
[in]data_descriptorthe complete/incomplete data set on which the EM algorithm will iterate.
Returns
the joint distribution corresponding to the model.
static plJointDistribution plLearner::learn_model_parameters ( const std::vector< plLearnObject * > &  learn_objects,
const plComputableObjectList &  init_distribs,
plDataDescriptor &  data_descriptor 
)
static

Learns the parameters of a model.

There can be arbitrary missing data in the learning observations provided by data_descriptor. An EM (Expectation-Maximization) algorithm is used. This EM algorithm is implemented using plEMLearner and is run until convergence.

Parameters
[in]learn_objectsa vector of incremental learning objects allowing to provide the structure (dependencies), the parametrical form of each distribution, and the corresponding priors.
[in]init_distribsinitial distributions of the EM algorithm. This parameter is useful only when the data set is incomplete (ie, contains missing values).
[in]data_descriptorthe complete/incomplete data set on which the EM algorithm will iterate.
Returns
the joint distribution corresponding to the model.
